doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 33 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 8/19/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 33 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 8/19/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Jim Levin and Philip Reed, member of the Minority Task Force, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund2.Discussion about minorities with AIDS with footage of a protest outside of St. Patrick's CathedralCOMMERCIAL: Prevention campaign by SWISS-AIDS-ASSISTANCE3.Continuation of discussion on minorities with AIDSCOMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund4.James Minter, member of the Front Runners, talks about engaging political canidates on AIDS topics5. News Watch, Man gets custody of his partners son after he dies of AIDS 6.Public pool closed after an HIV positive man swam in it in Williamson, West VirginiaCOMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser7.GCN Sports, Professional football teams offer voluntary AIDS testing for players, Tom Cousineau denies that he's gay, footage of diver Matt Scoggin and Greg LouganisCOMMERCIAL: First Hand8.Lavender Health interview with Michael Shernoff, from Chelsea Psychotherapy Associates, talks about finding a therapist9.Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Show Bitz, discussion about the play, Steel MagnoliasCOMMERCIAL: Manscape2.Naming Names, criticism about the AIDS reporting of newspaper,"The Daily News"COMMERCIAL: "Stop AIDS" The Swiss Federal Office of Public Health3.Media Watch, Interview with pornographer and musican Chris Rage, features music video with footage of Rage's filmsCOMMERCIAL:The Monster4.Inside Out, comedy sketch/satire where Sisky and Ebie look at homoeroticism in the film "The Color of Money" and "Top Gun"
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 33 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 8/19/1987]: August 1987
